_activate.desc: Send this attribute if you want to activate an inactive subscription.

_deactivate.desc: Send this attribute if you want to dactivate an active subscription.

strategy.desc: The inventory model's shipping strategy: one between 'no_split' (default), 'split_shipments', 'ship_from_primary' and 'ship_from_first_available_or_primary'.

stock_locations_cutoff.desc: The maximum number of stock locations used for inventory computation.

stock_reservation_cutoff.desc: The duration in seconds of the generated stock reservations.

put_stock_transfers_on_hold.desc: Indicates if the the stock transfers must be put on hold automatically with the associated shipment.

manual_stock_decrement.desc: Indicates if the the stock will be decremented manually after the order approval.

inventory_return_locations.desc: The resources that assign a priority to each inventory model return location.

priority.desc: The inventory return location priority within the associated invetory model.

api_key.desc: The public key linked to your API credential.

session_id.desc: The identifier of the payment session.

client_token.desc: The public token linked to your API credential. Available upon session creation.

payment_methods.desc: The merchant available payment methods for the assoiated order. Available upon session creation.

auth_token.desc: The token returned by a successful client authorization, mandatory to place the order.

mismatched_amounts.desc: Indicates if the order current amount differs form the one of the created payment intent.

_update.desc: Send this attribute if you want to update the payment session with fresh order data.

payment_instrument.desc: Information about the payment instrument used in the transaction.

order.desc: The order associated to the Klarna payment, that is set as its payment source.

payment_gateway.desc: The associated payment gateway, inherited by the order payment_method.

sku_code.desc: The code of the associated SKU.

bundle_code.desc: The code of the associated bundle.

_external_price.desc: When creating or updating a new line item, set this attribute to '1' if you want to inject the unit_amount_cents price from an external source. Any successive price computation will be done externally, until the attribute is reset to '0'.

_update_quantity.desc: When creating a new line item, set this attribute to '1' if you want to update the line item quantity (if present) instead of creating a new line item for the same SKU.

_reserve_stock.desc: Send this attribute if you want to reserve the stock for the line item's SKUs quantity. Stock reservations expiration depends on the inventory model's cutoff. When used on update the existing active stock reservations are renewed. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

currency_code.desc: The international 3-letter currency code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard, automatically inherited from the order's market.

unit_amount_cents.desc: The unit amount of the line item, in cents. Can be specified only via an integration application, or when the item is missing, otherwise is automatically computed by using one of the available methods.

unit_amount_float.desc: The unit amount of the line item, float. This can be useful to track the purchase on thrid party systems, e.g Google Analyitcs Enhanced Ecommerce.

formatted_unit_amount.desc: The unit amount of the line item, formatted. This can be useful to display the amount with currency in you views.

compare_at_amount_cents.desc: The compared price amount, in cents. Useful to display a percentage discount.

options_amount_cents.desc: The options amount of the line item, in cents. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

options_amount_float.desc: The options amount of the line item, float.

formatted_options_amount.desc: The options amount of the line item, formatted.

discount_cents.desc: The discount applied to the line item, in cents. When you apply a discount to an order, this is automatically calculated basing on the line item total_amount_cents value.

discount_float.desc: The discount applied to the line item, float. When you apply a discount to an order, this is automatically calculated basing on the line item total_amount_cents value.

formatted_discount.desc: The discount applied to the line item, fromatted. When you apply a discount to an order, this is automatically calculated basing on the line item total_amount_cents value.

total_amount_cents.desc: Calculated as unit amount x quantity + options amount, in cents.

total_amount_float.desc: Calculated as unit amount x quantity + options amount, float. This can be useful to track the purchase on thrid party systems, e.g Google Analyitcs Enhanced Ecommerce.

formatted_total_amount.desc: Calculated as unit amount x quantity + options amount, formatted. This can be useful to display the amount with currency in you views.

tax_amount_cents.desc: The collected tax amount, otherwise calculated as total amount cents - discount cent * tax rate, in cents.

tax_amount_float.desc: The collected tax amount, otherwise calculated as total amount cents - discount cent * tax rate, float.

formatted_tax_amount.desc: The collected tax amount, otherwise calculated as total amount cents - discount cent * tax rate, formatted.

name.desc: The name of the line item. When blank, it gets populated with the name of the associated item (if present).
name.example: Men's Black T-shirt with White Logo (XL)

image_url.desc: The image_url of the line item. When blank, it gets populated with the image_url of the associated item (if present, SKU only).

discount_breakdown.desc: The discount breakdown for this line item (if calculated).

tax_rate.desc: The tax rate for this line item (if calculated).

tax_breakdown.desc: The tax breakdown for this line item (if calculated).

item_type.desc: The type of the associated item. One of 'skus', 'bundles', 'gift_cards', 'shipments', 'payment_methods', 'adjustments', 'percentage_discount_promotions', 'free_shipping_promotions', 'buy_x_pay_y_promotions', 'free_gift_promotions', 'fixed_price_promotions', 'external_promotions', 'fixed_amount_promotions', or 'flex_promotions'.

frequency.desc: The frequency which generates a subscription. Must be supported by existing associated subscription_model.

coupon_code.desc: The coupon code, if any, used to trigger this promotion line item. null for other line item types or if the promotion line item wasn't triggered by a coupon.

circuit_state.desc: The circuit breaker state, by default it is 'closed'. It can become 'open' once the number of consecutive failures overlaps the specified threshold, in such case no further calls to the failing callback are made.

circuit_failure_count.desc: The number of consecutive failures recorded by the circuit breaker associated to this resource, will be reset on first successful call to callback.

_reset_circuit.desc: Send this attribute if you want to reset the circuit breaker associated to this resource to 'closed' state and zero failures count. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

order.desc: The associated order.

item.desc: The polymorphic item associated to the line item. One of 'skus', 'bundles', 'gift_cards', 'shipments', 'payment_methods', 'adjustments', 'percentage_discount_promotions', 'free_shipping_promotions', 'buy_x_pay_y_promotions', 'free_gift_promotions', 'fixed_price_promotions', 'external_promotions', 'fixed_amount_promotions', or 'flex_promotions'.

name.desc: The name of the line item option. When blank, it gets populated with the name of the associated SKU option.

currency_code.desc: The international 3-letter currency code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard, automatically inherited from the order's market.

unit_amount_cents.desc: The unit amount of the line item option, in cents. When you add a line item option to an order, this is automatically populated from associated SKU option's price.

unit_amount_float.desc: The unit amount of the line item option, float. This can be useful to track the purchase on thrid party systems, e.g Google Analyitcs Enhanced Ecommerce.

formatted_unit_amount.desc: The unit amount of the line item option, formatted. This can be useful to display the amount with currency in you views.

total_amount_cents.desc: The unit amount x quantity, in cents.

total_amount_float.desc: The unit amount x quantity, float. This can be useful to track the purchase on thrid party systems, e.g Google Analyitcs Enhanced Ecommerce.

formatted_total_amount.desc: The unit amount x quantity, formatted. This can be useful to display the amount with currency in you views.

delay_hours.desc: The shipping delay that the customer can expect when adding this option (hours). Inherited from the associated SKU option.

delay_days.desc: The shipping delay that the customer can expect when adding this option (days, rounded).

options.desc: Set of key-value pairs that represent the selected options.

status.desc: The link status. One of 'disabled', 'expired', 'pending', or 'active'.

domain.desc: The link URL second level domain.

external_prices_url.desc: The URL used to overwrite prices by an external source.

external_order_validation_url.desc: The URL used to validate orders by an external source.

private.desc: Indicates if market belongs to a customer_group.

shipping_cost_cutoff.desc: When specified indicates the maximum number of shipping line items with cost that will be added to an order.

price_list.desc: The active price list. Can be the one associated to the active scheduler or the base one if there are no schedulers.

base_price_list.desc: The base price list associated to the market, no matter the active price scheduler.

created_at.desc: Time at which the resource was created.

metadata.desc: Set of key-value pairs that you can attach to the resource. This can be useful for storing additional information about the resource in a structured format.

number.desc: The order identifier. Can be specified if unique within the organization (for enterprise plans only), default to numeric ID otherwise. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

autorefresh.desc: Save this attribute as 'false' if you want prevent the order to be refreshed automatically at each change (much faster).

place_async.desc: Save this attribute as 'true' if you want perform the place asynchronously. Payment errors, if any, will be collected afterwards.

status.desc: The order status. One of 'draft' (default), 'pending', 'editing', 'placing', 'placed', 'approved', or 'cancelled'.

payment_status.desc: The order payment status. One of 'unpaid' (default), 'authorized', 'partially_authorized', 'paid', 'partially_paid', 'voided', 'partially_voided', 'refunded', 'partially_refunded', or 'free'.

fulfillment_status.desc: The order fulfillment status. One of 'unfulfilled' (default), 'in_progress', 'fulfilled', or 'not_required'.

guest.desc: Indicates if the order has been placed as guest.

editable.desc: Indicates if the order can be edited.

customer_email.desc: The email address of the associated customer. When creating or updating an order, this is a shortcut to find or create the associated customer by email.

customer_password.desc: The password of the associated customer. When creating or updating an order, this is a shortcut to sign up the associated customer.

language_code.desc: The preferred language code (ISO 639-1) to be used when communicating with the customer. This can be useful when sending the order to 3rd party marketing tools and CRMs. If the language is supported, the hosted checkout will be localized accordingly.

currency_code.desc: The international 3-letter currency code as defined by the ISO 4217 standard, automatically inherited from the order's market.

tax_included.desc: Indicates if taxes are included in the order amounts, automatically inherited from the order's price list.

tax_rate.desc: The tax rate for this order (if calculated).

freight_taxable.desc: Indicates if taxes are applied to shipping costs.
freight_taxable.required: optional, default is 'false' or set by tax calculator

payment_method_taxable.desc: Indicates if taxes are applied to payment methods costs.
payment_method_taxable.required: optional, default is 'false' or set by tax calculator

adjustment_taxable.desc: Indicates if taxes are applied to positive adjustments.
adjustment_taxable.required: optional, default is 'false' or set by tax calculator

gift_card_taxable.desc: Indicates if taxes are applied to purchased gift cards.
gift_card_taxable.required: optional, default is 'false' or set by tax calculator

requires_billing_info.desc: Indicates if the billing address associated to this order requires billing info to be present.

country_code.desc: The international 2-letter country code as defined by the ISO 3166-1 standard, automatically inherited from the order's shipping or billing addresses.

shipping_country_code_lock.desc: The country code that you want the shipping address to be locked to. This can be useful to make sure the shipping address belongs to a given shipping country, e.g. the one selected in a country selector page. Not relevant if order contains only digital products.

coupon_code.desc: The coupon code to be used for the order. If valid, it triggers a promotion adding a discount line item to the order.

gift_card_code.desc: The gift card code (at least the first 8 characters) to be used for the order. If valid, it uses the gift card balance to pay for the order.

gift_card_or_coupon_code.desc: The gift card or coupon code (at least the first 8 characters) to be used for the order. If a gift card mathes, it uses the gift card balance to pay for the order. Otherwise it tries to find a valid coupon code and applies the associated discount.

subtotal_amount_cents.desc: The sum of all the SKU line items total amounts, in cents.

subtotal_amount_float.desc: The sum of all the SKU line items total amounts, float.

formatted_subtotal_amount.desc: The sum of all the SKU line items total amounts, formatted.

shipping_amount_cents.desc: The sum of all the shipping costs, in cents.

shipping_amount_float.desc: The sum of all the shipping costs, float.

formatted_shipping_amount.desc: The sum of all the shipping costs, formatted.

payment_method_amount_cents.desc: The payment method costs, in cents.

discount_amount_cents.desc: The sum of all the discounts applied to the order, in cents (negative amount).

discount_amount_float.desc: The sum of all the discounts applied to the order, float.

formatted_discount_amount.desc: The sum of all the discounts applied to the order, formatted.

adjustment_amount_cents.desc: The sum of all the adjustments applied to the order, in cents.

adjustment_amount_float.desc: The sum of all the adjustments applied to the order, float.

formatted_adjustment_amount.desc: The sum of all the adjustments applied to the order, formatted.

gift_card_amount_cents.desc: The sum of all the gift_cards applied to the order, in cents.

gift_card_amount_float.desc: The sum of all the gift_cards applied to the order, float.

formatted_gift_card_amount.desc: The sum of all the gift_cards applied to the order, formatted.

total_tax_amount_cents.desc: The sum of all the taxes applied to the order, in cents.

total_tax_amount_float.desc: The sum of all the taxes applied to the order, float.

formatted_total_tax_amount.desc: The sum of all the taxes applied to the order, formatted.

subtotal_tax_amount_cents.desc: The taxes applied to the order's subtotal, in cents.

subtotal_tax_amount_float.desc: The taxes applied to the order's subtotal, float.

formatted_subtotal_tax_amount.desc: The taxes applied to the order's subtotal, formatted.

shipping_tax_amount_cents.desc: The taxes applied to the order's shipping costs, in cents.

shipping_tax_amount_float.desc: The taxes applied to the order's shipping costs, float.

formatted_shipping_tax_amount.desc: The taxes applied to the order's shipping costs, formatted.

payment_method_tax_amount_cents.desc: The taxes applied to the order's payment method costs, in cents.

payment_method_tax_amount_float.desc: The taxes applied to the order's payment method costs, float.

formatted_payment_method_tax_amount.desc: The taxes applied to the order's payment method costs, formatted.

adjustment_tax_amount_cents.desc: The taxes applied to the order adjustments, in cents.

adjustment_tax_amount_float.desc: The taxes applied to the order adjustments, float.

formatted_adjustment_tax_amount.desc: The taxes applied to the order adjustments, formatted.

total_amount_cents.desc: The order's total amount, in cents.

total_taxable_amount_cents.desc: The order's total taxable amount, in cents (without discounts).

total_taxable_amount_float.desc: The order's total taxable amount, float.

formatted_total_taxable_amount.desc: The order's total taxable amount, formatted.

subtotal_taxable_amount_cents.desc: The order's subtotal taxable amount, in cents (equal to subtotal_amount_cents when prices don't include taxes).

subtotal_taxable_amount_float.desc: The order's subtotal taxable amount, float.

formatted_subtotal_taxable_amount.desc: The order's subtotal taxable amount, formatted.

shipping_taxable_amount_cents.desc: The order's shipping taxable amount, in cents (equal to shipping_amount_cents when prices don't include taxes).

shipping_taxable_amount_float.desc: The order's shipping taxable amount, float.

formatted_shipping_taxable_amount.desc: The order's shipping taxable amount, formatted.

payment_method_taxable_amount_cents.desc: The order's payment method taxable amount, in cents (equal to payment_method_amount_cents when prices don't include taxes).

payment_method_taxable_amount_float.desc: The order's payment method taxable amount, float.

formatted_payment_method_taxable_amount.desc: The order's payment method taxable amount, formatted.

adjustment_taxable_amount_cents.desc: The order's adjustment taxable amount, in cents (equal to discount_adjustment_cents when prices don't include taxes).

adjustment_taxable_amount_float.desc: The order's adjustment taxable amount, float.

formatted_adjustment_taxable_amount.desc: The order's adjustment taxable amount, formatted.

total_amount_with_taxes_cents.desc: The order's total amount (when prices include taxes) or the order's total + taxes amount (when prices don't include taxes, e.g. US Markets or B2B).

total_amount_with_taxes_float.desc: The order's total amount with taxes, float.

formatted_total_amount_with_taxes.desc: The order's total amount with taxes, formatted.

fees_amount_cents.desc: The fees amount that is applied by Commerce Layer, in cents.

fees_amount_float.desc: The fees amount that is applied by Commerce Layer, float.

formatted_fees_amount.desc: The fees amount that is applied by Commerce Layer, formatted.

duty_amount_cents.desc: The duty amount that is calculated by external services, in cents.

duty_amount_float.desc: The duty amount that is calculated by external services, float.

formatted_duty_amount.desc: The duty amount that is calculated by external services, formatted.

place_total_amount_cents.desc: The total amount at place time, in cents, which is used internally for editing.

place_total_amount_float.desc: The total amount at place time, float.

formatted_place_total_amount.desc: The total amount at place time, formatted.

skus_count.desc: The total number of SKUs in the order's line items. This can be useful to display a preview of the customer shopping cart content.

line_item_options_count.desc: The total number of line item options. This can be useful to display a preview of the customer shopping cart content.

shipments_count.desc: The total number of shipments. This can be useful to manage the shipping method(s) selection during checkout.

tax_calculations_count.desc: The total number of tax calculations. This can be useful to monitor external tax service usage.

validations_count.desc: The total number of external validation performed. This can be useful to monitor if external validation has been triggered.

errors_count.desc: The total number of resource errors.

payment_source_details.desc: An object that contains the shareable details of the order's payment source.

token.desc: A unique token that can be shared more securely instead of the order's id.

cart_url.desc: The cart url on your site. If present, it will be used on our hosted checkout application.

return_url.desc: The return url on your site. If present, it will be used on our hosted checkout application.

terms_url.desc: The terms and conditions url on your site. If present, it will be used on our hosted checkout application.

privacy_url.desc: The privacy policy url on your site. If present, it will be used on our hosted checkout application.

checkout_url.desc: The checkout url that was automatically generated for the order. Send the customers to this url to let them checkout the order securely on our hosted checkout application.

_archive.desc: Send this attribute if you want to archive the order.

_unarchive.desc: Send this attribute if you want to unarchive the order.

_pending.desc: Send this attribute if you want to move a draft or placing order to pending. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

_place.desc: Send this attribute if you want to place the order.

_cancel.desc: Send this attribute if you want to cancel a placed order. The order's authorization will be automatically voided.

_approve.desc: Send this attribute if you want to approve a placed order. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

_approve_and_capture.desc: Send this attribute if you want to approve and capture a placed order. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

_authorize.desc: Send this attribute if you want to authorize the order's payment source.

_authorization_amount_cents.desc: Send this attribute as a value in cents if you want to overwrite the amount to be authorized.

_capture.desc: Send this attribute if you want to capture an authorized order. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

_refund.desc: Send this attribute if you want to refund a captured order. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

_fulfill.desc: Send this attribute if you want to mark as fulfilled the order (shipments must be cancelled, shipped or delivered). Cannot be passed by sales channels.

_update_taxes.desc: Send this attribute if you want to force tax calculation for this order (a tax calculator must be associated to the order's market).

_nullify_payment_source.desc: Send this attribute if you want to nullify the payment source for this order.

_billing_address_clone_id.desc: The id of the address that you want to clone to create the order's billing address.

_shipping_address_clone_id.desc: The id of the address that you want to clone to create the order's shipping address.

_customer_payment_source_id.desc: The id of the customer payment source (i.e. credit card) that you want to use as the order's payment source.

_shipping_address_same_as_billing.desc: Send this attribute if you want the shipping address to be cloned from the order's billing address.

_billing_address_same_as_shipping.desc: Send this attribute if you want the billing address to be cloned from the order's shipping address.

_commit_invoice.desc: Send this attribute if you want commit the sales tax invoice to the associated tax calculator (currently supported by Avalara).

_refund_invoice.desc: Send this attribute if you want refund the sales tax invoice to the associated tax calculator (currently supported by Avalara).

_save_payment_source_to_customer_wallet.desc: Send this attribute if you want the order's payment source to be saved in the customer's wallet as a customer payment source.

_save_shipping_address_to_customer_addre.desc: Send this attribute if you want the order's shipping address to be saved in the customer's address book as a customer address.

_save_billing_address_to_customer_addres.desc: Send this attribute if you want the order's billing address to be saved in the customer's address book as a customer address.

_refresh.desc: Send this attribute if you want to manually refresh the order.

_validate.desc: Send this attribute if you want to trigger the external validation for the order.

_create_subscriptions.desc: Send this attribute upon/after placing the order if you want to create order subscriptions from the line items that have a frequency.

_start_editing.desc: Send this attribute if you want to edit the order after it is placed. Remember you cannot exceed the original total amount. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

_stop_editing.desc: Send this attribute to stop the editing for the order and return back to placed status. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

placed_at.desc: Time at which the order was placed.

approved_at.desc: Time at which the order was approved.

cancelled_at.desc: Time at which the order was cancelled.

payment_updated_at.desc: Time at which the order's payment status was last updated.

fulfillment_updated_at.desc: Time at which the order's fulfillment status was last updated.

refreshed_at.desc: Last time at which an order was manually refreshed.

archived_at.desc: Time at which the resource has been archived.

subscription_created_at.desc: Time at which the order has been marked to create a subscription from its recurring line items.

circuit_state.desc: The circuit breaker state, by default it is 'closed'. It can become 'open' once the number of consecutive failures overlaps the specified threshold, in such case no further calls to the failing callback are made.

circuit_failure_count.desc: The number of consecutive failures recorded by the circuit breaker associated to this resource, will be reset on first successful call to callback.

_reset_circuit.desc: Send this attribute if you want to reset the circuit breaker associated to this resource to 'closed' state and zero failures count. Cannot be passed by sales channels.

available_payment_methods.desc: The available payment methods for the order. Useful to present the customer with a list of choices during the checkout. Only enabled payment methods are included in the list.

available_customer_payment_sources.desc: The available customer payment sources for the order. Useful to present the customer with a list of choices during the checkout.

available_free_skus.desc: The available SKUs eligible as free gifts once added to the order. Useful to present the customer with a list of possible free gifts during the checkout. The list is filled by SKUs which belongs to matching free gift promotions.

available_free_bundles.desc: The available bundles eligible as free gifts once added to the order. Useful to present the customer with a list of possible free gifts during the checkout. The list is filled by bundles which belongs to matching free gift promotions.

shipments.desc: The associated shipments (automatically generated based on the inventory model).

frequency.desc: The frequency of the subscription. Use one of the supported within 'hourly', 'daily', 'weekly', 'monthly', 'two-month', 'three-month', 'four-month', 'six-month', 'yearly', or provide your custom crontab expression (min unit is hour). Must be supported by existing associated subscription_model.

activate_by_source_order.desc: Indicates if the subscription will be activated considering the placed source order as its first run.

place_target_order.desc: Indicates if the subscription created orders are automatically placed at the end of the copy.

renewal_alert_period.desc: Indicates the number of hours the renewal alert will be triggered before the subscription next run. Must be included between 1 and 720 hours.

customer_email.desc: The email address of the customer, if any, associated to the source order.

expires_at.desc: The expiration date/time of this subscription (must be after starts_at).

last_run_at.desc: The date/time of the subscription last run.

next_run_at.desc: The date/time of the subscription next run. Can be updated but only in the future, to copy with frequency changes.

occurrencies.desc: The number of times this subscription has run.

errors_count.desc: Indicates the number of subscription errors, if any.

succeeded_on_last_run.desc: Indicates if the subscription has succeeded on its last run.

options.desc: The subscription options used to create the order.

_deactivate.desc: Send this attribute if you want to mark this subscription as inactive.

_cancel.desc: Send this attribute if you want to mark this subscription as cancelled.

_convert.desc: Send this attribute if you want to convert a manual subscription to an automatic one. A subscription model is required before conversion.

external_promotions_errors.desc: Enables raising of API errors in case of external promotion failure, default is false.

eel_pfc.desc: When shipping outside the US, you need to provide either an Exemption and Exclusion Legend (EEL) code or a Proof of Filing Citation (PFC). Which you need is based on the value of the goods being shipped. Value can be one of "EEL" o "PFC".

contents_type.desc: The type of item you are sending.

contents_explanation.desc: If you specify 'other' in the 'contents_type' attribute, you must supply a brief description in this attribute.

customs_certify.desc: Indicates if the provided information is accurate.

customs_signer.desc: This is the name of the person who is certifying that the information provided on the customs form is accurate. Use a name of the person in your organization who is responsible for this.

non_delivery_option.desc: In case the shipment cannot be delivered, this option tells the carrier what you want to happen to the parcel. You can pass either 'return', or 'abandon'. The value defaults to 'return'. If you pass 'abandon', you will not receive the parcel back if it cannot be delivered.

restriction_type.desc: Describes if your parcel requires any special treatment or quarantine when entering the country. Can be one of 'none', 'other', 'quarantine', or 'sanitary_phytosanitary_inspection'.

restriction_comments.desc: If you specify 'other' in the restriction type, you must supply a brief description of what is required.

customs_info_required.desc: Indicates if the parcel requires customs info to get the shipping rates.

shipping_label_url.desc: The shipping label url, ready to be downloaded and printed.

shipping_label_file_type.desc: The shipping label file type. One of 'application/pdf', 'application/zpl', 'application/epl2', or 'image/png'.

tracking_number.desc: The tracking number associated to this parcel.

tracking_status.desc: The tracking status for this parcel, automatically updated in real time by the shipping carrier.

tracking_status_detail.desc: Additional information about the tracking status, automatically updated in real time by the shipping carrier.

tracking_status_updated_at.desc: Time at which the parcel's tracking status was last updated.

tracking_details.desc: The parcel's full tracking history, automatically updated in real time by the shipping carrier.

carrier_weight_oz.desc: The weight of the parcel as measured by the carrier in ounces (if available).

signed_by.desc: The name of the person who signed for the parcel (if available).

delivery_confirmation.desc: The type of delivery confirmation option upon delivery.
